summary: The Audio-Only Telehealth Access Act of 2025 aims to amend Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to allow for Medicare coverage and payment for audio-only telehealth services. This means that healthcare providers can be reimbursed for providing care to patients through audio-only communication, expanding access to telehealth services, particularly during emergencies. The bill specifies the conditions for this coverage, referencing services identified in existing telehealth provisions.
